trans-unit.source: Represents the look and feel of a row in a table layout.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle> class represents the user interface (UI) characteristics of a row in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel>.
The styles for all the rows in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> are collected in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel.RowStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This simple class offers the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle.SizeType%2A> for a row.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle"></xref> class to its default state.

This constructor sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle.SizeType%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SizeType.AutoSize> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle.Height%2A> property to 0.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle"></xref> class using the supplied <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SizeType"></xref> value.
This constructor sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle.Height%2A> property to 0.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle.SizeType"></xref> indicating how the row should be should be sized relative to its containing table.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle"></xref> class using the supplied <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.SizeType"></xref> and height values.
The `height` parameter will take on different meanings depending on the `sizeType` parameter.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle.Height%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle.SizeType"></xref> indicating how the row should be should be sized relative to its containing table.
The preferred height in pixels or percentage of the , depending on sizeType.
height is less than 0.
Gets or sets the height of a row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle.Height%2A> property will take on different meanings depending on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle.SizeType%2A> property.
The following table describes the possible meanings of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle.Height%2A>.
`SizeType` value
`Height` interpretation
The preferred row height in pixels (fractional portion ignored).
Not applicableâ€”the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle.Height%2A> property is ignored.
The preferred row height as a percentage of the containing table.

The preferred height of a row in pixels or percentage of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel"></xref>, depending on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle.SizeType"></xref> property.
The value is less than 0 when setting this property.
